intro: Gymnopsis pohlii, commonly known as the Pohli's burr, is a species of flowering plant native to parts of South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants known for their distinctive seed structures. The plant is characterized by its spiny, spherical fruit that encloses the seeds, aiding in seed dispersal by attaching to animal fur. Gymnopsis pohlii typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for studies on plant adaptations and ecological interactions.
